alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Gove; Graham; Logan; Norton; Sheridan; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 7:29PM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow, strong northerly winds and blowing snow. Blizzard conditions possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas. * WHEN...From Monday morning through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions. This includes portions of the Interstate 70 corridor in northwest Kansas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A low pressure system anticipated to develop over the Desert Southwest on Sunday will intensify and track eastward across the Southern and Central Plains Monday into Monday night. Confidence is high that this storm will produce significant impacts across portions of the Central Plains. Precipitation amounts, and impacts, in northwest Kansas and adjacent portions of Colorado and Nebraska are highly dependent upon the precise track of this system. A small southward deviation in the track would confine significant impacts to far eastern portions of the area. A small northward deviation, on the other hand, would bring significant impacts to a much greater portion of the area.
info.instruction: A significant winter storm will affect portions of the Central Plains Monday into Monday night. Residents and travelers are urged to monitor the forecast for further updates, and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Decatur; Gove; Graham; Logan; Norton; Sheridan; Wichita
